1303.description: Repealing a specified provision of law authorizing an interrogation of a law enforcement officer to be suspended for 10 days until the officer can obtain representation; requiring a specified representative for a law enforcement officer to be appointed by a specified entity under specified circumstances; and requiring a representative appointed under the Act to represent the law enforcement officer at all times during the investigation unless the representative is replaced or the officer waives the right to counsel.

1304.title: Unincorporated Nonprofit Associations - Members and Officers - Personal Liability
1304.description: Prohibiting a specified member of an unincorporated nonprofit association from being sued for specified debts, obligations, or other liabilities of the unincorporated nonprofit association; prohibiting an officer or a director of an unincorporated nonprofit association from being sued for specified debts, obligations, or other liabilities of the unincorporated nonprofit association under specified circumstances; etc.

1305.title: State Government - Functionality and Security of Web Sites - Certification
1305.description: Prohibiting a governmental unit from making a Web site available to the public unless specified conditions are met; requiring, under specified circumstances, a governmental unit to obtain a specified certification before a specified date; prohibiting a Web site from being certified as secure unless specified conditions are met; requiring a governmental unit to immediately notify the Secretary of Information Technology if the governmental unit is unable to obtain a specified certification; etc.

1306.title: Children in Out-of-Home Placement - Annual Notice of Benefits
1306.description: Requiring the Social Services Administration to provide specified information, at least one time each year, about available benefits for a child in out-of-home placement who is at least 13 years old; authorizing the Administration to provide the information to the child at a specified permanency planning hearing or review hearing or by certified mail; requiring the Secretary of Human Resources to submit a report on the implementation of the Act to committees of the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2014; etc.

1307.title: Limited Liability Companies - Fees - Young Adult-Owned Businesses
1307.description: Altering the processing fee for articles of organization and the filing fee for specified annual reports of a Maryland limited liability company composed of members at least 51% of whom are individuals under 25 years of age; and providing for the termination of the Act at the end of December 31, 2016.

1308.title: State Personnel - Applicants for Employment - Criminal History Records Check - Exemptions
1308.description: Exempting specified positions in the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene from a provision of law that prohibits specified appointing authorities in State government from inquiring into the criminal record or criminal history of an applicant for employment until the applicant has been provided an opportunity for an interview.

1309.title: Recordation Tax - Home Equity Loan Modifications - Exemption
1309.description: Altering a specified exemption from the recordation tax as it relates to home equity loan modifications under specified circumstances; etc.

1310.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance - Aftermarket Parts - Warranty Requirements
1310.description: Requiring an insurer that requires the use of aftermarket parts for the repair of a motor vehicle covered under a policy of motor vehicle insurance issued or delivered by the insurer to provide to the insured an express written warranty that any aftermarket parts used for the repair of the motor vehicle are merchantable; requiring the warranty to include specified coverage and have a duration of one year after the repair of the motor vehicle is completed, or the length of ownership of the motor vehicle, whichever is longer; etc.

1311.title: Program Open Space Sites - Public Access
1311.description: Authorizing a local governing body to use specified Program Open Space funds for the provision of public access to specified land; Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to consider the feasibility of providing specified public access for specified Program Open Space projects; requiring specified subdivisions to consider the feasibility of providing public access for specified Program Open Space projects; etc.

1312.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1312.title: Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems - Mobile Integrated Health Care Services - Study
1312.description: Requiring the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems (MIEMSS) to conduct a study on the potential for development of mobile integrated health care services in the State; requiring MIEMSS to submit specified reports to the General Assembly on or before specified dates; and providing for the termination of the Act at the end of June 30, 2016.

1313.title: Maryland Wage Payment and Collection Law - Awards of Certain Fees and Costs and Prohibition Against Retaliation
1313.description: Authorizing the court, on a specified finding in an action on behalf of an employee for a violation of the Maryland Wage Payment and Collection Law, to award the Attorney General reasonable counsel fees and other costs; authorizing the court, on a specified finding in an action by an employee for a violation of the Wage Payment and Collection Law, to award the employee reasonable counsel fees and other costs; prohibiting an employer from taking specified adverse action against an employee under specified circumstances; etc.

1314.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1314.title: Minority Business Participation - Liquidated Damages Provisions - Exclusion for Architectural and Engineering Services Contracts
1314.description: Excluding specified architectural and engineering services contracts from a specified requirement related to the inclusion of a liquidated damages provision in contracts that contain minority business enterprise participation goals.

1315.title: Crimes - Sale of Drug Paraphernalia to a Minor - Local Law Authorizing Business License Revocation for a Second or Subsequent Violation
1315.description: Authorizing the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to adopt a local law that authorizes the county or municipal corporation to revoke or not to renew the business license of an establishment for the second or subsequent conviction of an employee of the establishment if the violation involves selling or delivering drug paraphernalia to a minor and occurs on the property of the business establishment.

1316.title: Higher Education - Maryland Technology Internship Program
1316.description: Establishing the Maryland Technology Internship Program; establishing the purposes of the Program; requiring the University of Maryland, Baltimore County (UMBC) to administer the Program and undertake specified activities to carry out the purposes of the Program; establishing specified eligibility requirements for participation in the Program; requiring UMBC to prepare a specified annual report; requiring the Governor to include funds in the State budget for reimbursement of intern stipends and other specified purposes; etc.

1317.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
1317.title: Evaluation of the Application of Minority Business Enterprise Program by the Public Service Commission - Data Collection and Termination Extension
1317.description: Requiring the Department of Transportation, the Governor's Office of Minority Affairs, and the Public Service Commission to collect specified data regarding specified minority business enterprise participation with specified electricity suppliers from specified electricity suppliers that have entered into a specified memorandum of understanding; altering the date by which specified persons must submit a specified report to the General Assembly; and altering the termination of a specified Act.

1318.title: Real Property - Foreclosures - Deficiency Judgments Prohibited and Definition of "Secured Party" (Foreclosure Protection Act)
1318.description: Defining the term "secured party" for purposes of provisions of law governing actions to foreclose specified mortgages and deeds of trust; and prohibiting a lender who forecloses on a specified mortgage or deed of trust from filing a motion for a deficiency judgment if specified proceeds are insufficient to satisfy the debt and accrued interest.

1319.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters; Withdrawn
1319.title: College Park Student Housing Subsidy Reduction Act PG 405-14
1319.description: Altering the area within which the Prince George's County school facilities surcharge does not apply to multi-family housing designated as student housing.

1320.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1320.title: Natalie M. LaPrade Medical Marijuana Commission - Treatment, Certification, Licensing, and Registration
1320.description: Expanding the scope of authority and the duties of the Natalie M. LaPrade Medical Marijuana Commission relating to the treatment of patients qualified to use medical marijuana; authorizing the Commission to set fees; providing that the fees are part of a specified fund; encouraging the Commission to approve specified applications; authorizing the Commission to approve specified applications; requiring the Commission to make an annual report regarding specified medical marijuana treatment centers; etc.

1321.title: Foreclosure - Moratorium, Notices, Penalties, Redemption Period, and Study
1321.description: Prohibiting a lender from maintaining an action to foreclose a mortgage or deed of trust on residential property in the State for 6 months; establishing a specified penalty for a person who files an affidavit relating to a foreclosure notice when the person knows or has reason to know that the contents of the notice are inaccurate; requiring a court to send a specified checklist to the mortgagor or grantor of owner-occupied residential property when a specified foreclosure is filed; etc.

1322.title: Public School Construction - Creative Financing Study
1322.description: Requiring the Interagency Committee on School Construction to conduct a specified study and make specified recommendations regarding the development of specified alternative financing methods; requiring the Committee to solicit input from specified entities; requiring the Committee to submit an interim report on or before December 1, 2014, and a final report on or before September 1, 2015; etc.

1323.title: Maryland Youth Employment Act of 2014
1323.description: Allowing a qualified employer that employs specified qualified employees for specified time periods a credit against the State income tax in specified amounts; authorizing an individual to apply to the Department of Business and Economic Development to be certified as a qualified employee; authorizing a business entity to apply to the Department to be certified as a qualified employer; applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014; etc.

1324.title: Education - Discipline in Public Schools
1324.description: Prohibiting a principal in a public school from taking specified disciplinary action against a student who brings a specified object onto school property or creates a specified object on school property that may not be reasonably mistaken for a firearm and that does not create a danger to anyone.

1325.title: Public-Private Partnerships - Disclosure of Involvement in Deportations - Requirement
1325.description: Prohibiting, under specified circumstances, a private entity from being qualified as a bidder for a public-private partnership; requiring an entity to certify to the reporting agency whether the entity had direct involvement in the deportation of specified victims; requiring an entity, under specified circumstances, to certify and disclose to the reporting agency specified information regarding the entity's direct involvement in the deportation of specified victims; etc.

1326.title: Election Law - Redistricting Ballot Questions - Map of Proposed Districts
1326.description: Requiring that a specified statement providing notice of a ballot question relating to congressional redistricting include the address of a Web site where a map of the boundaries of the proposed districts may be viewed; and requiring that a map of the proposed districts be posted in each polling place if there is a question on the ballot relating to congressional redistricting.

1327.title: Maryland Cooperative Housing Act - Transparency Requirements and Member Rights
1327.description: Requiring specified meetings of a cooperative housing corporation to be open to the members of the cooperative housing corporation or their agents; requiring the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation to keep books and records in a specified manner, and to cause an audit of the books and records under specified circumstances; establishing a specified dispute settlement mechanism for specified complaints or demands arising between specified cooperative housing corporations and their members; etc.

1328.title: Baltimore County Board of Education - Procurement for Construction-Related Projects for Schools
1328.description: Making specified provisions of law concerning the advertising for bids for specified procurements costing more than $25,000 apply to construction-related projects for schools in Baltimore County; providing for the prospective application of the Act; etc.

1329.title: Task Force to Reduce Incarceration in Maryland
1329.description: Establishing the Task Force to Reduce Incarceration in Maryland; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; prohibiting a member of the Task Force from receiving specified compensation, but authorizing the reimbursement of specified expenses; requiring the Task Force to meet at least once per month and hold at least two meetings at which the public is invited to testify; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding specified matters; etc.

1331.title: Task Force to Study Sports Injuries in High School Female Athletes
1331.description: Establishing the Task Force to Study Sports Injuries in High School Female Athletes; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; prohibiting a member of the Task Force from receiving specified compensation, but authorizing the reimbursement of specified expenses; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding specified matters; providing for the termination of the Act at the end of December 31, 2015; etc.

1332.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1332.title: Public Health - Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program
1332.description: Establishing the Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program in the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene; providing for the purpose of the Program; authorizing the Department to adopt specified regulations, collect specified fees, issue and renew specified certificates, and conduct and approve specified training programs relating to the Program; establishing qualifications for applicants for a certificate; requiring the Department to issue specified certificates to specified applicants; etc.

1333.title: Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission - Regulations to Prohibit Smoking PG/MC 112-14
1333.description: Requiring the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission to adopt regulations on or before June 30, 2015, to prohibit on property under its jurisdiction the smoking of specified tobacco products; and providing for specified exemptions and exclusions.

1334.title: Health - Smoking - Public Playgrounds and Swimming Pools - Prohibition
1334.description: Prohibiting smoking on a public playground and in and around a specified swimming pool.

1335.title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - Enrollment of Individuals - Information
1335.description: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to ask specified individuals for specified information when facilitating enrollment of the individuals in specified health insurance plans and specified health insurance programs; etc.

1336.last_action: Hearing 3/10 at 1:00 p.m. (Health and Government Operations)
1336.title: Maryland No-Fault Birth Injury Fund
1336.description: Establishing a system for adjudication of a claim involving a birth-related neurological injury; excluding specified rights and remedies of a claimant and specified other persons; providing for specified procedures; providing for specified benefits and compensation of a claimant under the Act; establishing the Maryland No-Fault Birth Injury Fund; providing for specified premiums and insurance surcharges to be used to finance and administer the Fund; etc.

1337.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
1337.title: State Construction Projects - Work-Based Learning and Local Hiring
1337.description: Requiring the Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning, in consultation with the Department of Transportation and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, to establish a specified program to maximize opportunities for work-based learning and local hiring in connection with specified State construction projects; requiring the program to include a specified local hiring plan and method of reporting specified information; etc.

1338.title: Drivers' Licenses - Disorder, Disease, or Physical Disability - Defining and Reporting
1338.description: Requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, the Medical and Chirurgical Faculty, and the State Board of Examiners in Optometry to define diseases and physical disabilities that may render an individual unable to exercise reasonable control over a motor vehicle; expanding the scope of health care professionals authorized to make a specified report to the Medical Advisory Board; etc.

1339.title: Education - Calculation of State Appropriation - Information Transparency in Budget Books
1339.description: Requiring specified information about the calculation of the State appropriation for primary and secondary education for each local school system to be included in the State budget books.

1340.title: Sexual Assault Survivors' Right to Know Act
1340.description: Requiring a health care provider that performs a sexual assault evidence collection kit exam on a victim of sexual assault to provide the victim or the victim's representative with specified contact information; requiring a law enforcement agency that receives a sexual assault evidence collection kit to provide specified information within 30 days after a request by a specified victim or victim's representative; altering a specified reporting requirement regarding DNA collection and analysis; etc.

1341.last_action: Hearing 3/06 at 1:00 p.m. (Health and Government Operations)
1341.title: Workers' Compensation - Reimbursement for Repackaged and Relabeled Drugs - Fee Schedule and Requirements
1341.description: Requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to adopt in regulation a pharmaceutical fee schedule applicable to repackaged and relabeled drugs; providing for the setting of reimbursement rates for specified drugs; requiring the Commission to impose a specified fine on an employer or its insurer under specified circumstances; requiring that a pharmaceutical bill submitted to an employer or its insurer for reimbursement of specified drugs contain specified information; etc.

1342.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
1342.title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Opioids Time Lock Dispenser Pilot Program
1342.description: Requiring the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a specified opioids time lock dispenser pilot program; requiring the Secretary to adopt specified regulations to carry out the pilot program; prohibiting the Secretary from requiring that a veteran pay a fee in order to get a time lock dispenser; requiring the Secretary annually to submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the progress of the pilot program; and terminating the Act after September 30, 2018.

1343.title: Task Force on Preventing Child Sexual Abuse
1343.description: Establishing the Task Force on Preventing Child Sexual Abuse; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; prohibiting a member of the Task Force from receiving specified compensation, but authorizing the reimbursement of specified expenses; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding specified matters relating to the prevention of child sexual abuse and report its findings to the Governor on or before December 31, 2014; etc.

1344.title: Electric Vehicles and Recharging Equipment - Rebates and Tax Credits
1344.description: Repealing the credit against the State income tax for the costs of purchasing qualified electric vehicle recharging equipment; establishing, for fiscal years 2015 through 2017, the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Rebate Program to provide rebates to individuals and entities for the costs of acquiring and installing vehicle recharging equipment; extending the credit against the motor vehicle excise tax for specified qualified plug-in electric drive vehicles for a specified period of time; requiring a report; etc.

1345.title: Real Property - Prohibition on Acquiring Mortgages or Deeds of Trust by Condemnation
1345.description: Prohibiting the State or any of its instrumentalities or political subdivisions from acquiring mortgages or deeds of trust by condemnation.

1346.title: Animal Welfare - Research Facilities - Dogs and Cats
1346.description: Requiring specified medical and scientific research facilities that use dogs and cats for research purposes to be licensed by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners; requiring the Board to set a license fee in a specified manner; prohibiting specified research facilities from using specified dogs and cats for research purposes; prohibiting specified research facilities from performing specified devocalization surgeries; requiring the Board to adopt specified regulations; etc.

1347.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations
1347.title: State Government - Advertisements - Paid for by Maryland Taxpayers
1347.description: Requiring that any advertisement that is paid for by the State and issued by or on behalf of specified courts, the Maryland General Assembly, or specified departments and units of the Executive Branch of State government include the statement, "This message has been paid for by the taxpayers of Maryland"; etc.

1348.title: Public Safety Diversity Act of 2014
1348.description: Requiring the Department of State Police, when it advertises for or recruits new employees, to include advertising that is targeted toward underrepresented communities and individuals; requiring the Department to report to specified committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1 of each year on initiatives the Department has employed to improve diversity in recruitment and the outcome of those initiatives; etc.

1349.title: Fair Employment Preservation Act of 2014
1349.description: Providing that, for purposes of employment discrimination and retaliation, an act or omission of an employee may be construed to be an act or omission of the employer of the employee under specified circumstances; and applying the Act prospectively.

1350.title: Baltimore City - Special Police Officers and School Police Officers
1350.description: Repealing a specified provision of law relating to the appointment of special police officers in Baltimore City; and repealing an obsolete provision of law relating to Baltimore City school police officers.

1351.title: Secretary of State and Attorney General - Charitable Enforcement and Protection of Charitable Assets
1351.description: Authorizing the Attorney General to take specified actions relating to investigations of alleged violations of laws relating to charitable organizations and charitable representatives; providing that a specified enforcement action or other remedy is subject to specified immunity or limitation on liability; requiring that an action to enforce specified provisions of the Act be brought within a specified period of time; etc.

1352.title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Gift Cards Purchased for Emergency Personnel
1352.description: Allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for the value of specified gift cards provided to specified emergency personnel; requiring a taxpayer to meet specified filing requirements to claim the subtraction modification; providing that the value of specified gift cards may not qualify for the subtraction modification; requiring the Comptroller to adopt specified regulations; etc.

1353.title: Motor Vehicle Administration - Multiple Copies of Driving Records - Fees
1353.description: Prohibiting the Motor Vehicle Administration, when multiple copies of an individual's driving record are requested simultaneously, from charging a fee exceeding a specified amount for each copy provided after the first copy.

1354.title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Department of Defense Survivor Benefits Program
1354.description: Allowing a subtraction modification under the State income tax for payments received under a United States Department of Defense survivor benefits program; applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013; etc.

1356.title: Income Tax Credit - Veterinary Services for Adopted Police Dogs
1356.description: Allowing specified individuals a credit against the State income tax for the cost of specified veterinary services for adopted police dogs; providing that the credit may not exceed a specified amount; providing that the credit may not be carried forward to another taxable year; etc.

1357.title: Income Tax Credit - Cat and Dog Adoption
1357.description: Allowing an individual who adopts a cat or dog from an animal shelter or a rescue facility a maximum credit of $100 against the State income tax; providing that an individual may not claim the credit for more than 1 taxable year with respect to the same cat or dog; requiring the Comptroller to adopt regulations; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

1358.title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Law Enforcement Officer Survivor Benefits Program
1358.description: Allowing a subtraction modification under the State income tax for payments received under a law enforcement officer survivor benefits program by the surviving spouse of a law enforcement officer; applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013; etc.

1359.title: Vehicle Laws - Speed Monitoring Systems - Warning
1359.description: Requiring a specified agency to mail a warning notice instead of a citation for a first violation by the owner or driver of a vehicle recorded by a speed monitoring system in the local jurisdiction.

1360.title: Joint Committee to Review the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Audit by the Office of Legislative Audits
1360.description: Establishing the Joint Committee to Review the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange; requiring the Committee to investigate and review specified matters; authorizing the Committee to issue subpoenas, compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of documents, administer oaths, and cause the deposition of specified witnesses; requiring the Office of Legislative Audits to conduct a performance audit of the Exchange; etc.

1361.title: Frederick County - Slot Machines for Nonprofit Organizations
1361.description: Adding Frederick County to the list of counties in which specified nonprofit fraternal, religious, and war veterans' organizations may own and operate not more than five slot machines under specified circumstances.

1362.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Economic Matters Withdrawn
1362.title: Health Care Provider Malpractice Insurance - Scope of Coverage
1362.description: Repealing a prohibition on the inclusion, in a policy that insures a health care provider against damages due to medical injury arising from providing or failing to provide health care, of coverage for the defense of a health care provider in a specified disciplinary hearing; etc.

1363.title: Maryland Wage and Hour Law - Exemptions - Employees Receiving Social Security Disability Insurance Benefits
1363.description: Providing that the Maryland Wage and Hour Law does not apply to specified employees who receive federal Social Security disability insurance benefits.

1364.title: Corporations and Associations - Securities - Maryland Small Business Funding Act
1364.description: Exempting a specified security issued to a resident of the State by a specified business entity from specified registration and filing requirements under specified circumstances; exempting a specified Web site that is used to facilitate the sale of a specified security from specified registration and filing requirements under specified circumstances; requiring the Division of Securities within the Office of the Attorney General to inspect and review specified Web sites under specified circumstances; etc.

1365.title: Public Schools - Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation and Automated External Defibrillator Instruction (Breanna's Law)
1365.description: Requiring a public school student to complete, as part of a specified curricula, instruction in cardiopulmonary resuscitation that includes hands-only cardiopulmonary resuscitation and the use of an automated external defibrillator beginning with students entering Grade 9 in the 2015-2016 school year; etc.

1366.title: Natural Resources - Forests, Parks, and Recreation Areas - Posted Notice of Safety Information
1366.description: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to post a notice in a conspicuous location at each State forest, park, and recreational area that contains specified safety information.

1367.title: State Boat Act - Dealer's License - Lienholder Exemption
1367.description: Exempting a holder of a lien created under Title 16, Subtitle 2 of the Commercial Law Article, including an auctioneer and a company known as a lien and recovery company, from specified licensing requirements solely for the purpose of selling vessels in accordance with Title 16 of the Commercial Law Article.

1368.title: Ethics Law - Financial Disclosure Statement by Elected Local Official of Municipal Corporation - Confidential Information
1368.description: Altering financial disclosure provisions governing elected local officials of a municipal corporation; prohibiting the disclosure of specified information concerning specified relatives that is included in the financial disclosure statement filed by an elected local official of a municipal corporation; providing exceptions; etc.

1369.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1369.title: Commercial Law - Financing Statements - Refusal of Filing Office to Accept
1369.description: Authorizing a filing office to refuse to accept a financing statement for filing under specified circumstances; requiring a specified filing office to send a specified notice to specified individuals under specified circumstances; authorizing a specified filing office to request specified documentation under specified circumstances; etc.

1370.title: Criminal Procedure - Financial Crimes Against Vulnerable and Elder Adults - Petition to Freeze Assets
1370.description: Authorizing a State's Attorney to file a petition to freeze assets of a defendant charged with a specified financial crime involving a vulnerable or elder adult under specified circumstances; requiring that a petition to freeze assets be served in accordance with the Maryland Rules and include specified information; requiring that a petition to freeze assets be mailed to specified lienholders and specified financial institutions; etc.

1371.title: Creation of a State Debt - Anne Arundel County - The Arc of the Central Chesapeake Region - Moreland Parkway Facility
1371.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $500,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of The Arc of the Central Chesapeake Region, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to a facility on Moreland Parkway, located in Anne Arundel County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1372.title: Environment - Permits to Construct or Materially Alter an Incinerator - Limitations on Issuance
1372.description: Prohibiting the Secretary of the Environment from issuing a permit to construct or materially alter an incinerator located within 3 miles of specified locations; prohibiting a person from constructing an incinerator within 3 miles of specified locations; altering the application of a specified prohibition on specified facilities operating on January 1, 1997; etc.

1373.title: Creation of a State Debt - Caroline County - Old Caroline High School Phase II
1373.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $200,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Mayor and Town Council of the Town of Denton for specified development or improvement purposes related to Old Caroline High School, located in Caroline County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1374.title: Creation of a State Debt - Anne Arundel County - Mayo Civic Association Project
1374.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $50,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Mayo Civic Association, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of the Mayo Civic Association Community Hall, including the planning, design, construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of tennis courts, located in Anne Arundel County; etc.

1375.title: Creation of a State Debt - Frederick County - Governor Thomas Johnson High School Stadium
1375.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $50,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Thomas Johnson High School Patriots Boosters, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Governor Thomas Johnson High School Stadium, including installing a turf field, located in Frederick County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1376.title: Office of Health Care Quality - Abuser Registry Workgroup
1376.description: Requiring the members of the Abuser Registry Workgroup in the Office of Health Care Quality to elect a chair; requiring the Office of Health Care Quality to submit a specified report to the Governor, specified legislative committees, and the members of the Workgroup; and extending the termination date of the Workgroup.

1377.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore City - Garrett-Jacobs Mansion
1377.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $300,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Trustees of the Garrett-Jacobs Mansion Endowment Fund, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Garrett-Jacobs Mansion, located in Baltimore City; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1378.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore City - Everyman Theatre
1378.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $300,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of The Everyman Theatre, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Everyman Theatre, located in Baltimore City; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1379.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1379.title: Developmental Disabilities - Residential Programs - Reimbursement for Visitation Absence Days
1379.description: Requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to reimburse specified providers of services to individuals with developmental disabilities in specified residential programs for a visitation absence day; prohibiting the Department from imposing specified limitations on specified reimbursement to specified providers for visitation absence days; etc.

1380.title: Anne Arundel County - Sheriff - Salary Increases
1380.description: Increasing the annual salary of the Sheriff of Anne Arundel County to $128,657 for calendar year 2014 and $133,000 for calendar year 2015, and each subsequent calendar year; repealing a specified requirement that the annual salary of the sheriff equal the salary of a captain in the Anne Arundel County Police Department at a specified rate in the pay scale; providing that the Act does not apply to the salary or compensation of the Sheriff while serving in a term of office beginning before the effective date of the Act; etc.

1381.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1381.title: Maryland Transportation Authority - Toll Increases - Legislative Approval Required
1381.description: Prohibiting the Maryland Transportation Authority from increasing a toll, a fee, a mileage rate range, a pricing period, a toll zone, or any other charge on any part of any transportation facilities project unless the General Assembly approves the increase through legislation enacted into law or the Authority makes a specified determination; etc.

1382.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1382.title: Environment - Retail Service Stations - Setback Certification
1382.description: Requiring specified retail service stations constructed after October 1, 2014 to meet specified requirements; requiring a person constructing a specified retail service station on or after October 1, 2014 to apply to the Department of the Environment for a setback certification; requiring the Department to issue a setback certification if a specified retail service station meets specified requirements; and requiring the Department to adopt regulations.

1383.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Ways and Means; Withdrawn
1383.title: Income Tax Credit - Pass-Through Entities
1383.description: Allowing an individual a credit against the State income tax equal to the amount by which the tax, when applying a specified effective tax rate, on the individual's distributive share of pass-through entity income exceeds the tax on the individual's distributive share of pass-through entity income when applying a tax rate of 2.875%; providing that an individual may not claim the credit if the individual's effective tax rate is less than 2.875%; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

1384.title: Washington County Gaming Commission - Membership - Conflict of Interest
1384.description: Repealing provisions of law prohibiting a member of the Washington County Gaming Commission from serving on the gaming commission if the member serves on the board of directors or as an officer of an organization that applies for funds from the gaming commission; requiring the gaming commission to adopt conflict of interest regulations applicable to members of the gaming commission; etc.

1385.title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Wine Sampling or Tasting
1385.description: Altering a specified restriction on the number of bottles of wine that may remain open at any one time at a wine sampling or tasting event in Frederick County; prohibiting a single individual at a wine sampling or tasting event in the county from consuming more than 6 ounces of wine from all brands in a single day; and requiring the Board to adopt specified regulations.

1386.title: Creation of a State Debt - Anne Arundel County - Calvary Food Bank
1386.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $75,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Calvary Community Economic Development Corporation for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of the Calvary Food Bank, located in Anne Arundel County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1387.title: State Department of Education - Assessment Report for Broadband Capabilities in Public Schools
1387.description: Requiring the State Department of Education to report to the General Assembly on specified matters relating to broadband capabilities in local school systems on or before December 1, 2014; and terminating the Act at the end of December 31, 2014.

1388.title: Task Force on the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect
1388.description: Establishing the Task Force on the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding specified matters, including methods to adopt and implement policy addressing the prevention of child abuse that may include age-appropriate curricula for students in prekindergarten through fifth grade; requiring a report on or before December 1, 2014; providing for the termination of the Act at the end of June 30, 2015; etc.

1389.title: St. Mary's County - Public Officials - Salaries
1389.description: Increasing the salary of the Treasurer of St. Mary's County, the Sheriff of St. Mary's County, the Judges of the Orphans' Court for St. Mary's County, the President of the Board of County Commissioners of St. Mary's County, and the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County in each calendar year 2015-2018; and providing that the provisions of the Act shall take effect at the beginning of the next following term of office.

1390.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore City - Baltimore Arts Realty Corporation (BARCO) North Avenue Arts Building
1390.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $250,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Baltimore Arts Realty Corporation for specified development or improvement purposes related to the BARCO North Avenue Arts Building, located in Baltimore City; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1391.title: Maryland Wholesome Meat Act - Prohibitions - Equines and Equine Meat
1391.description: Prohibiting a person from buying, selling, transporting, or offering or receiving for sale or transportation any equine carcass or the meat of any equine if the person knows or reasonably should know that the carcass or meat will be used for human consumption; and prohibiting a person from buying, selling, transporting, or offering or receiving for sale or transportation any equine if the person knows or reasonably should know that the equine is intended for slaughter for human consumption.

1392.title: St. Mary's County - John Hanson Briscoe Circuit Courthouse for St. Mary's County
1392.description: Renaming the St. Mary's County Circuit Courthouse, located in Leonardtown, St. Mary's County, the John Hanson Briscoe Circuit Courthouse for St. Mary's County.

1393.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - The Writer's Center
1393.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $300,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of The Writer's Center, Inc. for the acquisition, planning, design, construction, repair, renovation, reconstruction, and capital equipping of The Writer's Center facility, located in Montgomery County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1394.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore City - Arena Players Project
1394.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $750,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Arena Players, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Arena Players facility, located in Baltimore City; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1395.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1395.title: Vehicle Laws - Work Zone Speed Control Systems - Hours of Operation
1395.description: Establishing that a work zone speed control system may be used only while work is being performed in the work zone or during the 1-hour period before work begins and after work ends in the work zone.

1396.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1396.title: Vehicle Laws - Rental Vehicles - Notice Regarding Authorized Drivers
1396.description: Requiring a person who rents a motor vehicle to a consumer to provide the consumer with a specified form that notifies the consumer of specified provisions of law that restrict who may drive the rented vehicle and states the penalty for specified violations relating to authorized drivers of rented motor vehicles; requiring the person to require the consumer to sign the form and to keep a copy of the signed form; establishing a $40 civil penalty for a violation of the Act; etc.

1397.title: Frederick County Board of Education - Discipline Regulations
1397.description: Authorizing the Frederick County Board of Education to follow or to disregard specified discipline guidelines established by the State Board of Education when adopting specified discipline regulations for the schools under the jurisdiction of the county board; and establishing that specified regulations of the Frederick County Board of Education shall prevail if there is a conflict between specified State Board guidelines and regulations and specified county board regulations.

1398.title: Washington County - Sheriff and County Commissioners - Salaries
1398.description: Providing that the Sheriff of Washington County shall receive a salary of the greater of $100,000 or the salary set by the County Commissioners of Washington County under specified provisions of law; requiring the County Commissioners of Washington County to set the salaries for specified local offices by local law, within a specified time frame and subject to specified conditions; providing that the County Commissioners of Washington County shall receive a specified salary; etc.

1399.title: County Boards of Education - Discipline Regulations
1399.description: Authorizing county boards of education to follow or to disregard specified discipline guidelines established by the State Board of Education when adopting specified discipline regulations for the schools under the jurisdiction of the county board; and establishing that specified regulations of a county board shall prevail if there is a conflict between specified State Board guidelines and regulations and specified county board regulations.

1400.title: Election Law - Fair Campaign Financing Fund - Income Tax Checkoff
1400.description: Establishing a checkoff on the individual income tax return through which a United States citizen or legal permanent resident may make a contribution to the Fair Campaign Financing Fund; requiring the Comptroller to take specified actions to administer the checkoff; etc.

1401.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters; Withdrawn
1401.title: Agricultural Transfer Tax - Distribution to Mel Noland Woodland Incentives Fund
1401.description: Increasing from $200,000 to $300,000 the maximum amount of specified tax proceeds required to be deposited by the Comptroller into the Mel Noland Woodland Incentives Fund; and altering the parcels of land for which specified counties are required to remit agricultural transfer tax proceeds to the Comptroller to include parcels of land that are at least 90% woodland.

1402.title: Homestead Exemption - Bankruptcy - Interest in Manufactured Home
1402.description: Altering specified provisions of law concerning an exemption for a specified amount in an individual's interest in owner-occupied, residential real property in a bankruptcy proceeding to include an interest in a manufactured home that has been converted to real property in a specified manner; and applying the Act prospectively.

1403.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1403.title: Health Care Disparities, Cultural and Linguistic Competency, and Health Literacy - Continuing Education
1403.description: Requiring specified applicants and health care professionals to provide to specified boards evidence of completion of continuing education requirements; requiring the boards, in consultation with the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, to adopt specified regulations; stating the intent of the General Assembly that the regulations require 5% to 10% of the total required continuing education credits be in the areas of health care disparities, cultural and linguistic competency, and health literacy; etc.

1404.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1404.title: Department of Health and Mental Hygiene - Establishment of a Sickle Cell Disease Outreach Program
1404.description: Requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to establish, before June 1, 2015, a specified sickle cell disease outreach program; requiring that the program provide specified programs, support, and services; and requiring the Governor, beginning with fiscal year 2016, to include in the State budget an appropriation of at least $250,000 for the program.

1405.title: Election Law - Signed Voting Authority Cards - Maintenance
1405.description: Requiring each local board of elections to maintain voting authority cards that have been signed under a specified provision of law for 3 years by physically storing the voting authority cards, or electronically scanning and storing the voting authority cards in the same manner that the local board stores other electronic materials.

1406.title: Local Government - Restrictions on Income Producing Real Property - Fiscal Impact Study
1406.description: Requiring the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to provide a copy of specified rent-control legislation to and request a specified study from the Governor prior to enacting the legislation; requiring the Governor to designate an appropriate State agency to contract for the study; requiring that a copy of the study be provided to specified persons; and providing that the Act does not apply to specified rent-controlled properties.

1407.title: Public Institutions of Higher Education - Smoke-Free or Tobacco-Free Campuses - Funding
1407.description: Providing that, if a public institution of higher education maintains a smoke-free or tobacco-free campus, any State support from the General Fund provided to the institution shall be reduced by a percentage equal to the ratio of revenues generated by the taxes on tobacco products under Title 12 of the Tax - General Article divided by all revenues credited to the General Fund.

1408.title: Anne Arundel County - Collection of Hotel Taxes and Distribution of Revenues - City of Annapolis
1408.description: Providing that Anne Arundel County may authorize the City of Annapolis to collect revenue generated in the City of Annapolis from the hotel tax; requiring the City of Annapolis to distribute and retain a specified percentage of that revenue if Anne Arundel County authorizes the City of Annapolis to collect the revenue; etc.

1409.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1409.title: Sterile Compounding Permits - Exemptions - Sterile Compounding Facilities That Only Compound for Immediate Use
1409.description: Authorizing, under specified circumstances, the State Board of Pharmacy to exempt a specified sterile compounding facility from a specified permit requirement; providing that a sterile compounding facility that receives a specified exemption is subject to inspection by the Board; authorizing the Board to withdraw an exemption under specified circumstances; etc.

1410.title: Howard County - Appointed Alcoholic Beverage Hearing Board - Compensation Ho. Co. 12-14
1410.description: Providing that the compensation for the Howard County Appointed Alcoholic Beverage Hearing Board shall be the amount set by the Howard County Council.

1411.title: Election Law - Petitions - Advance Determinations
1411.description: Providing that, under specified circumstances, the chief election official of the election authority shall prepare the format and a specified summary of an act or part of an act proposed to be petitioned to referendum; requiring the chief election official also to make a determination and certify the sufficiency of the petition within a specified time period; providing that a sponsor that seeks an advance determination of the sufficiency of a petition may not circulate the petition for signatures during a specified period; etc.

1412.title: Creation of a State Debt - Baltimore City - Gaudenzia's Park Heights Facility Renovation
1412.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $500,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of Gaudenzia, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Gaudenzia's Park Heights Facility, located in Baltimore City; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1413.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Palmer Park Boys & Girls Club
1413.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $50,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Palmer Park Boys & Girls Club, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Palmer Park Boys & Girls Club, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1414.last_action: Assigned a chapter number, enactment subject to constitutional referendum - Chapter 261
1414.title: Chief Executive Officer or County Executive - Special Election to Fill a Vacancy in Office
1414.description: Proposing an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to provide that a county charter may provide for the filling of a vacancy in the office of chief executive officer or county executive of a county by special election; submitting an amendment to the Maryland Constitution to the qualified voters of the State for their adoption or rejection; authorizing a special election to fill a vacancy in the office of chief executive officer or county executive of a charter county to be conducted by mail; etc.

1415.title: Crimes - Gang-Free Zones - Penalties for Gang Activity
1415.description: Prohibiting a person from threatening an individual, or a friend or family member of an individual, with or using physical violence to coerce, induce, or solicit the individual to participate in or prevent the individual from leaving a criminal gang in, on, or within a specified distance from a postsecondary school, specified property operated by a State or local transit authority, and a State or local recreation area or park; and increasing the penalty for specified gang activity.

1416.title: Unemployment Insurance - Work Sharing
1416.description: Altering provisions that apply to the work sharing unemployment insurance program; requiring that a decision by the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation to disapprove a work sharing plan identify the reasons for disapproval; altering requirements for a work sharing plan; prohibiting the Secretary from approving specified work sharing plans; altering eligibility criteria for specified employees; altering the computation of work sharing benefits; altering benefit charging provisions for specified employing units; etc.

1417.title: Education - Curriculum Content - Vocational Education and Training Programs
1417.description: Requiring the State Board of Education to develop curriculum content for a specified course in the requirements for entry into vocational education and training programs to be taught beginning with the 2015-2016 school year; and requiring each county board of education to determine which high schools in the county may offer specified curriculum content beginning with the 2015-2016 school year.

1420.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1420.title: Vehicle Laws - Motorcycles - Learners' Instructional Permits
1420.description: Requiring an applicant for a learner's instructional permit to operate a motorcycle who does not pass a specified knowledge test to pay a fee established by the Motor Vehicle Administration for each subsequent knowledge test taken by the applicant; and altering the expiration date for a specified learner's instructional permit to operate a motorcycle.

1424.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1424.title: Baltimore City - Work Zone Speed Control Systems - Hours of Operation
1424.description: Establishing that, in Baltimore City, a work zone speed control system may be used only while work is being performed in the work zone or during the 1-hour periods before work begins and after work ends in the work zone; etc.

1425.title: Harness Racing - Purses - Deductions Paid to an Organization
1425.description: Requiring that an organization representing a majority of standardbred owners and trainers set an amount to be deducted from open purses to be paid to the organization.

1426.title: Task Force to Study Expanding Metrorail Service in Southern Prince George's County
1426.description: Establishing the Task Force to Study Expanding Metrorail Service in Southern Prince George's County; providing for the membership, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; requiring the Task Force to consider specified transportation-related issues and make recommendations relating to expanding Metrorail service in specified areas of southern Prince George's County; requiring the Task Force to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2014; terminating the Act at the end of May 31, 2015; etc.

1427.title: Student Health and Fitness Act
1427.description: Requiring that a public school student in elementary school be provided a daily program of physical activity totaling at least 150 minutes of physical activity each week, including at least 90 minutes of physical education; requiring that the program of physical activity for a specified category of student be consistent with a specified plan for the student; requiring public elementary schools to designate a physical activity leadership team to plan and coordinate specified activities; etc.

1428.title: State Board of Education - Financial Literacy Curriculum - Graduation Requirement
1428.description: Requiring the State Board of Education to develop curriculum content for a course in financial literacy; requiring each county board of education to implement the financial literacy curriculum content developed by the State Board in every high school in the county; and requiring students to complete a course in financial literacy in order to graduate from high school.

1429.title: Health - State Children's Environmental Health and Protection Advisory Council - Composition
1429.description: Altering the composition of the State Children's Environmental Health and Protection Advisory Council; and increasing from 18 to 19 the number of members of the Advisory Council.

1430.title: Maryland Community Health Resources Commission - Sunset Extension
1430.description: Extending to June 30, 2025, the termination date for specified provisions of law related to the Maryland Community Health Resources Commission.

1431.title: Teaching Fellows for Maryland Scholarship Program
1431.description: Renaming the Maryland Teacher Scholarship to be the Teaching Fellows for Maryland scholarship and altering specified elements of the scholarship program; requiring specified institutions of higher education to provide matching funds to participate in a specified program; altering the eligibility criteria and service obligation associated with the scholarship; altering the amount of the award for a scholarship to be 100% of the annual tuition, mandatory fees, and room and board at specified institutions; etc.

1432.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1432.title: Task Force to Study Services and Resources Provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs
1432.description: Establishing the Task Force to Study Services and Resources Provided by the Department of Veterans Affairs; providing for the composition, chair, and staffing of the Task Force; requiring the Task Force to study and make recommendations regarding how to improve services and resources provided to veterans residing in the State; requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 31, 2014; and terminating the Act at the end of June 30, 2015.

1433.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Health and Government Operations; Withdrawn
1433.title: Community Services - Provider Reimbursement
1433.description: Repealing the Community Services Reimbursement Rate Commission; requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to establish and hire an independent contractor to verify a specified cost structure related to inflationary cost adjustments for community services providers; requiring the Department to conduct a specified study and assess specified cost structures in a specified manner; requiring a specified independent contractor to collect and analyze specified data and conduct a specified assessment; etc.

1434.title: Commercial Law - Financing Statements - Correction of Records
1434.description: Authorizing a specified individual who believes that a record indexed in a filing office relating to a financing statement is false or inaccurate to file a specified information statement; authorizing a specified individual to petition a specified circuit court to show cause why a specified record should not be declared invalid; requiring a specified petition to contain specified information; authorizing a show cause order to be granted ex parte; establishing requirements for an order to show cause; etc.

1435.title: Calvert County - Salaries of County Officials and County Commissioner Retirement Plan Participation
1435.description: Authorizing a County Commissioner of Calvert County to participate in the Calvert County Employees Retirement Savings Plan; altering the salaries of the Sheriff of Calvert County, Orphans' Court Judges for Calvert County, and Calvert County Treasurer; etc.

1436.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Environmental Matters; Withdrawn
1436.title: Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation - Lot Release - Demonstrated Financial Hardship
1436.description: Requiring the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to grant a 5-year extension for the time frame for receiving a nontransferable building permit if a landowner or child of a landowner demonstrates financial hardship; and exempting a lot owner granted an extension for demonstrated financial hardship from the requirement to reconvey a lot under specified circumstances.

1437.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - Metropolitan Ballet Theatre Relocation and Expansion
1437.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $60,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Metropolitan Ballet Theatre, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Metropolitan Ballet Theatre, located in Montgomery County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1438.title: Creation of a State Debt - Harford County - Edgewood Community Support Center Facility Completion
1438.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $50,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Edgewood Community Support Center, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Edgewood Community Support Center Facility, located in Harford County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1439.title: Family Law - Children's Civil Rights - Equal Parenting Time
1439.description: Creating a rebuttable presumption that joint legal custody and physical custody to each parent for approximately equal periods of time are in the best interest of the child in specified child custody proceedings.

1440.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1440.title: Income Tax Credit - Floating Garden Equipment
1440.description: Allowing an individual a credit against the State income tax for the purchase price of equipment used to install or maintain a floating garden; providing that the credit may not exceed a specified amount; providing that the credit may not be refundable or carried forward to another taxable year; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

1441.title: Maryland Transit Administration - Free Ridership for State Employees
1441.description: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to extend to employees of the Judicial Branch and the Legislative Branch of State government the application of any program, policy, or practice through which free ridership on transit vehicles is offered to employees of the Executive Branch of State government.

1442.title: Creation of a State Debt - Montgomery County - Silver Spring Volunteer Fire Department Station #16
1442.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $2,500,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Trustees of the Silver Spring Volunteer Fire Department, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Silver Spring Volunteer Fire Department Station #16, located in Montgomery County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1443.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1443.title: Allegany County - Marriage License Fees - Distribution to Cumberland Historic Cemetery Organization
1443.description: Authorizing the Board of County Commissioners of Allegany County to set an additional fee of $13 for each marriage license; requiring the clerk to pay the proceeds from the additional fee to the general fund of the county each month; and requiring the Board of County Commissioners to distribute the proceeds to the Cumberland Historic Cemetery Organization.

1444.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1444.title: Workers' Compensation - Heart Disease and Hypertension Presumption - Allegany County Correctional Officers
1444.description: Extending the presumption of compensability under the workers' compensation law to include, under specified conditions, Allegany County correctional officers who suffer from heart disease or hypertension resulting in partial or total disability or death; requiring Allegany County correctional officers to submit specified medical disclosures to the Allegany County Sheriff; allowing benefits under the Act to be added to retirement benefits subject to a specified limitation; etc.

1445.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2013 - Garrett County - Adventure Sports Center International
1445.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2013 to allow funds authorized for the Adventure Sports Center International project to be used for prior eligible expenditures incurred on or before June 1, 2013; etc.

1446.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1446.title: State Aid Reporting Requirement - Nonprofit Entities - Minority Business Participation
1446.description: Requiring a nonprofit entity that receives at least $750,000 of State aid during a fiscal year to submit a specified report to the Governor's Office of Minority Affairs on or before September 1 after the close of the fiscal year in which the State aid is received; requiring the report to contain specified information relating to the State aid and number and value of contracts between the nonprofit and certified minority business enterprises; etc.

1447.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Bowie Boys and Girls Club Pole Barn Structure
1447.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $100,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Board of Directors of the Bowie Boys and Girls Club, Inc. for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Bowie Boys and Girls Club Pole Barn Structure, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1448.title: Criminal Procedure - Marijuana Diversion Program
1448.description: Requiring each county to establish a specified marijuana diversion program; providing that a specified person who is charged with a violation of a specified provision of law prohibiting the use or possession of marijuana is eligible for the program; requiring a State's Attorney to offer to dismiss a specified charge by entering a nolle prosequi with a specified requirement or move that the court indefinitely postpone trial of the charge by marking the charge stet with a specified requirement under specified circumstances; etc.

1449.title: Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2012 - Prince George's County - Southern Area Indoor Aquatic Center
1449.description: Amending the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2012 to extend the deadline for the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission to present evidence of the matching funds for grants for the Southern Area Indoor Aquatic Center; changing the location of the Southern Area Indoor Aquatic Center from Riverdale to Fort Washington; etc.

1450.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1450.title: Environment - Marine Contractor Services - License Exceptions
1450.description: Authorizing an individual to perform marine contractor services without having to obtain a license from the Marine Contractors Licensing Board if the individual is assisting a residential or commercial property owner who is performing marine contractor services on the property owner's own property and the property owner is present and actively participating in the performance of the marine contractor services.

1451.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1451.title: Anne Arundel County - Electronic Instant Bingo Machines - Regulation
1451.description: Authorizing a war veterans' organization or fraternal organization in Anne Arundel County to operate not more than five electronic instant bingo machines if the organization obtains a license for each machine on or before June 1, 2015.

1453.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1453.title: Winter Driving Safety Act
1453.description: Requiring the State Highway Administration to establish a specified public information campaign on the importance of snow and ice removal from exposed vehicle surfaces; prohibiting a person from operating or towing a vehicle without removing from exposed vehicle surfaces specified snow and ice; establishing penalties for a violation of the Act and penalties for a violation of the Act that contributes to an accident under specified circumstances; etc.

1454.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Forest Heights Town Hall Renovation
1454.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $130,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Mayor and Town Council of the Town of Forest Heights for specified development or improvement purposes related to the Forest Heights Town Hall, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1455.title: Department of Health and Mental Hygiene - Board of Review - Jurisdiction
1455.description: Limiting the jurisdiction of the Board of Review of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to hear and determine appeals from decisions of the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene and units in the Department; authorizing the Board to hear and determine any appeal from a decision of the Secretary in a contested case concerning an individual's eligibility for or participation in specified programs; providing for the application of the Act to decisions of the Secretary of Health and Mental Hygiene issued on or after June 1, 2014; etc.

1456.title: State Correctional Officers' Bill of Rights - Definition of Correctional Officer
1456.description: Altering the definition of "correctional officer" to exclude the classification of correctional officer I for the purposes of the State Correctional Officers' Bill of Rights.

1457.title: Correctional Services - Charges Recommending Discipline - Investigative Period
1457.description: Establishing that a 90-day limitation after which a specified appointing authority in the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services may not bring charges recommending the imposition of discipline against a correctional officer does not apply to charges that relate to criminal activity under specified circumstances.

1458.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1458.title: Harford County - Gaming Events - License
1458.description: Adding a nonstock corporation that operates a chamber of commerce in Harford County and intends to raise money exclusively to support the membership of the chamber of commerce to the list of organizations that may obtain a license to conduct a gaming event in Harford County.

1459.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - Redevelopment of 4510 41st Avenue and 4516 41st Avenue
1459.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $150,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Mayor and Town Council of the Town of North Brentwood for specified development or improvement purposes related to the redevelopment of the buildings at 4510 41st Avenue and 4516 41st Avenue, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; etc.

1460.title: Hometown Heroes - Income Tax Subtraction Modification - Retirement Income of Law Enforcement, Fire, Rescue, and Emergency Services Personnel
1460.description: Providing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax under specified circumstances for specified retirement income attributable to a resident's employment as a law enforcement officer or the individual's service as fire, rescue, or emergency services personnel; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2013.

1461.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1461.title: Property and Casualty Insurance - Notices - Use of First-Class Mail Tracking Methods
1461.description: Altering the manner in which insurers are required to notify specified persons of the rescission, cancellation, nonrenewal, or termination of policies or binders of specified property or casualty insurance, or of an increase in the total premium for a policy of private passenger motor vehicle liability insurance; etc.

1462.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1462.title: Solar Farms - Construction Requirements - Exemptions
1462.description: Exempting a solar farm from the requirement to submit a grading and sediment control plan in order to obtain a permit for grading or construction; exempting a solar farm from the requirement to submit a forest stand delineation and forest conservation plan in order to obtain a permit for grading or construction; and exempting a solar farm from the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity before constructing a generating station if the solar farm meets specified requirements.

1463.title: Creation of a State Debt - Prince George's County - District Heights Family and Youth Services Bureau Facility Project
1463.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt not to exceed $250,000, the proceeds to be used as a grant to the Mayor and City Council of the City of District Heights for specified development or improvement purposes related to the District Heights Family and Youth Services Bureau Facility Project, located in Prince George's County; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds, subject to a requirement that the grantee provide and expend a matching fund; establishing a deadline for the encumbrance or expenditure of the loan proceeds; etc.

1464.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1464.title: Insurance - Reinsurance - Certification of Reinsurers
1464.description: Authorizing the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to use information provided by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) committee process to take specified actions relating to an applicant for certification as a reinsurer in Maryland; etc.

1465.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1465.title: Morticians and Funeral Directors - Contracts - Statement Regarding Availability of Internal Organs for Burial
1465.description: Altering the items that must be included in a specified contract to include a statement, under specified circumstances, regarding whether there are any internal organs that will not be available for burial with the deceased.

1466.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
1466.title: Vehicle Laws - Towing, Recovery, and Storage - Methods of Payment
